kSecure

enum.name: ChromeOSRecoveryReason
enum.summary: Reason for entering Recovery Mode. See platform/vboot_reference/firmware/2lib/include/2recovery_reasons.h

int.label: Recovery not requested.
Recovery requested from legacy utility.
User manually requested recovery via recovery button
RW firmware failed signature check (neither RW firmware slot was valid)
S3 resume failed
TPM error in read-only firmware (deprecated)
Shared data error in read-only firmware
Test error from S3Resume()
Test error from LoadFirmwareSetup() (deprecated)
Test error from LoadFirmware() (deprecated)
Latest tried RW firmware keyblock verification failed
Latest tried RW firmware key version too old
Latest tried RW firmware preamble verification failed
Latest tried RW firmware version too old
Latest tried RW firmware body verification failed
Firmware boot failure outside of verified boot (RAM init, missing SSD, etc.).
Recovery mode TPM initialization requires a system reboot. The system was already in recovery mode for some other reason when this happened.
EC software sync - other error
EC software sync - unable to determine active EC image
EC software sync - error obtaining EC image hash (deprecated)
EC software sync - error obtaining expected EC image
EC software sync - error updating EC
EC software sync - unable to jump to EC-RW
EC software sync - unable to protect / unprotect EC-RW
EC software sync - error obtaining expected EC hash
EC software sync - expected EC image doesn't match hash
Secure data inititalization error
GBB header is bad
Unable to clear TPM owner
Error determining/updating virtual dev switch
Error determining firmware slot
Unspecified/unknown error in read-only firmware
User manually requested recovery by pressing a key at developer warning screen
No OS kernel detected
OS kernel failed signature check
TPM error in rewritable firmware (deprecated)
RW firmware in dev mode, but dev switch is off
Shared data error in rewritable firmware
Test error from LoadKernel()
No bootable disk found (deprecated)
Rebooting did not correct TPM_E_FAIL or TPM_E_FAILEDSELFTEST
TPM setup error in read-only firmware
TPM write error in read-only firmware
TPM lock error in read-only firmware
TPM update error in read-only firmware
TPM read error in rewritable firmware
TPM write error in rewritable firmware
TPM lock error in rewritable firmware
EC software sync unable to get EC image hash
EC software sync invalid image hash size
Unspecified error while trying to load kernel
No bootable storage device in system
No bootable kernel found on disk
BCB related error in RW firmware
Secure data inititalization error 0
Fastboot mode requested in firmware
Recovery hash space lock error in RO firmware
Unspecified/unknown error in rewritable firmware
DM-verity error
Unspecified/unknown error in kernel.
Unspecified/unknown error in kernel
Recovery mode test from user-mode
Recovery requested by user-mode via BCB
Fastboot mode requested by user-mode
User requested recovery for training memory and rebooting.
User requested network based recovery
Unspecified/unknown error in user-mode

enum.name: DeterminePhysicalSectorSizeResult
enum.summary: The result of an attempt to determine the size of a physical sector of the disk to which a file is to be written.

int.label: Success

enum.int: The size was determined and recorded in Setup.Install.UnbufferedFileWriter.PhysicalSectorSize.

int.label: DriveInfoFailed
NoSizeValue

enum.int: GetFileDriveInfo() did not report the sector size.

int.label: GreaterThanFourK

enum.int: The device reported a sector size larger than 4096, which has been recorded in Setup.Install.UnbufferedFileWriter.PhysicalSectorSize.

int.label: NotPowerOfTwo

enum.int: The device reported a sector size that is not a power of two, which has been recorded in Setup.Install.UnbufferedFileWriter.PhysicalSectorSize.

enum.name: SetupInstallResult

int.label: First install of Chrome succeeded.
Same version reinstalled for repair.
Chrome successfully updated to new version.
No work done; launched existing Chrome.
Higher version of Chrome already exists.
User level install already exists.
Machine level install already exists.
Install/update failed.
Failed to patch setup.exe.
Current OS not supported.
OS API call failed.
Unable to get Temp directory.
Failed to uncompress Chrome archive.
Something wrong with the installer archive.
User trying system level install is not Admin.
Chrome not installed (during uninstall).
Chrome currently running (during uninstall).
User has confirmed Chrome uninstall.
User okayed uninstall and profile deletion.
Chrome successfully uninstalled.
Chrome uninstallation failed.
User cancelled Chrome uninstallation.
Unknown status (this should never happen).
Rename of new_chrome.exe to chrome.exe worked.
Rename of new_chrome.exe failed.
EULA dialog was not accepted by user.
EULA dialog was accepted by user.
EULA accepted with the crash option selected.
Installation directory is in use by another process.
Uninstallation required a reboot.
Chrome successfully updated but old version running.
Chrome repair failed as Chrome was running.
Setup has been re-launched as the interactive user.
The chrome-sxs option provided does not work with other command line options.
Failed to apply a diff patch.
A non-install option was called with an invalid installer state.
The arguments of --patch were missing or they were invalid for any reason.
No previous version archive found for differential update.
No multi-install products to update. The binaries will be uninstalled if they are not in use. (Removed in M84.)
The binaries were uninstalled. (Removed in M84.)
An unsupported legacy option was given.
Current CPU not supported.
Autoupdates are now enabled.
Autoupdates could not be enabled.
Unpacking the (possibly patched) uncompressed archive failed.
Rotation of the device trust key failed.
Rotation of the device trust key succeeded.
Creation of shortcuts succeeded.
DMToken deletion failed.
DMToken deletion succeeded.
Failed Device Trust Rotation: Invalid Permissions
Failed Device Trust Rotation: Conflict
Successfully configured the browser in a specified directory
Failed to configure the browser in a specified directory
No Error
Archive file not found
Archive file can not be opened
Archive can not be opened by extract tool.
File can not be extracted
Mapped file IO Exception
Can not get the name of extracted file
Can not create extracted file on disk
Can not write the extracted file on disk
Can not set the extract time to file (Deprecated)
Can not close extracted file (Deprecated)
Can not create file memory mapping
File CRC mismatch
There is not enough space on the disk.
I/O device error.
